AVAILABILITY

-> Available for freelance jobs & projects from 01 August 2020
-> Available for remote projects or projects at customers located in the Randstad area.

projects.title: Optimization of engine valve spring design based on chosen desired properties
projects.description: Worked on improving the design of an engine valve spring using the techniques of engineering optimization. To start the process, the problem was carefully formulated considering physical and computational limitations. Then, the problem was rigorously analysed and checked to see if it could be further simplified for computer implementation. After this step, various industry standard algorithms were used to find the optimized design parameters in the chosen design domain. MATLAB's Optimization Toolbox was extensively used for the entire optimization routine, with inbuilt functions like "fmincon", "fminbnd", "fminunc", among others. These functions were understood thoroughly for the algorithms they implemented. Finally, a comparison study of the computational efficiency of these algorithms was also done by monitoring the number of function evaluations, number of iterations, and computational time taken by the individual algorithms.

projects.title: FE Analysis of Flow Through a Nozzle Using SEPRAN Software Package
projects.description: The goal of this lab assignment was to solve numerically a given problem which has practical applications. The work was divided into two parts. The first one dealt with the mathematical background and analysis of the problem by means of the tools learnt during the course; the second one involves the implementation of the steps derived in part I by means of the FEM software package, “SEPRAN”, and Fortran.

projects.title: Implemented the dynamics of fluid-structure interactions  in MATLAB
projects.description:
Implemented the following FSI concepts in MATLAB:

1. Coupled displacements and loads at fluid and structure interfaces, with an analysis of different coupling approaches.
2. Mesh motion with interpolation of mesh deformation using different radial basis functions.
3. Formulation of DGCL to satisfy the ALE using different time-integration schemes.
4. Analysis of the errors in the solution obtained from the application of the different time-integration schemes.
5. Simulation of uniform flow on a moving 2D mesh.

For extensive details explaining the actual implementation in MATLAB, please go through the final reports linked here.

contributors.headline: Wissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter bei Deutsches Zentrum für Luft-und Raumfahrt e.V.

projects.title: Sail Shape Optimization with COMSOL and MATLAB
projects.description:
The optimization of the sail-shapes of a sailing boat was done by using MATLAB's Genetic Algorithm optimization routine, and the result was compared with a self-written line-search optimization algorithm (Golden Ratio). The physics was solved using COMSOL's CFD Module, with the optimization part of the process being handled by MATLAB. 
The objective function was chosen based on the research done by the Stanford Yacht Research Group (http://syr.stanford.edu/). Response surfaces of the objective function were generated after realising the instability of COMSOL to handle all kinds of values of the design variables. 
The optimization was done first using the popular global optimization routine, Genetic Algorithm (GA). The minima was found to be the global one by analysing the response surface and sail flow physics.
Next a line-search algorithm, the Golden Ratio method in conjunction with the Steepest Descent method was implemented by us to be compared with GA. Line search algorithms are local optimization routines, as was seen by the local minima in which the algorithm would get stuck. 
Finally, conclusions were drawn on the type of objective function, and the different possibilities of algorithms to be used. The results we obtained were analysed for the different set of conditions a sail boat might experience in real life. The scope of future work in this field was also discussed while identifying the need of more robust and efficient physics solvers.

projects.title: Longitudinal Dynamics of Formula Student Car modelled in MATLAB
projects.description: Modelled in MATLAB, the longitudinal dynamics of a Formula Student Car idealised as a 13-DOF system. The dynamics of the system was first mathematically expressed through the Lagrange equations, and then solved in MATLAB for better understanding of the working of the car. The modal solutions obtained were analysed to gauge the comfort level of the driver, and guidelines were formulated for the engineers to improve the car design.

contributors.headline: Co-Founder and COO at ARCEON B.V.

profile_positions.description:
Auxilium is one of the early bird companies that got started with the digital revolution in the Netherlands. Started in 1997, when the wider world had less of an idea of the coming changes to their way of life, Auxilium has been helping its clients adapt incredibly well to a digital climate.

I helped Auxilium in developing some key .Net Core projects. The clients ranged from large consultancies to very secure banking applications. The maintenance or developing applications from the ground up to be maintainable and performant were some of my responsibilities. I have also significantly increased (by more than 50%) the test coverage of some important projects.
profile_positions.title: .NET Developer

profile_positions.description:
Game Show Crew are a market leader in providing software solutions for the quizzing industry. They would like to enhance their market offering by releasing iOS and Android apps that support their platform and make the end user quizzing experience more interactive.

The apps now enable a rich quiz format. My role was to help Game Show Crew in developing a robust iOS and Android app, that can enable shared gameplay for thousands of users.
profile_positions.title: Xamarin / .Net Developer

profile_positions.description:
Situation: Mapiq is an innovative company with its own product on the market with the same name. Mapiq would like to enable employees in flexible workspaces gain control over their working environment. The product integrates with the various building systems, and also enables localisation via bluetooth and its own flagship app, Mapiq Now. Location based services then allow Mapiq to come up with better solutions and assistance for the end user.

Task: I am in a role of a software developer for the app, Mapiq Now. I work within a team to deliver key new features, various integrations, and the core localisation technology of the app.

Activities:
• Researched and architected the core localisation technology using GPS and bluetooth possible
in the app.
• Integrated the solution in the current architecture of the app in a robust way.
• Communicate with design and backend teams to deliver key features in the app to the end user.
• Development of test scenarios for the product to increase robustness of the product.

Results:
• Users can now be localised in the background, leading to a better experience of the product by
everyone in the office.
• Delivered on design requirements as per design specifications resulting in a beautiful and
functional app.
• Created a Swiss-army knife of a product for an employee of the modern office.

Technologies: Xamarin Forms, iOS, Android, C#, Visual Studio.
profile_positions.title: Xamarin Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
1. Developed a game for iOS and Android using libgdx, Java, and Android Studio. 

2. Developed a backend for the game in AWS API Gateway, AWS Lambda, and AWS RDS. The backend was used to store player scores and calculate high scores. 

3. Enabled Google Sign In for players to sign in and post scores. The backend was also connected to Google Sign In services to securely authenticate players.

4. Managed development of music and visual game assets by hiring freelancers from Fiverr.

5. Managed the release cycle of the game apps on Google Play Console, and Apple App Store Connect.
profile_positions.title: (Mobile + Cloud) Project Lead Developer

profile_positions.description:
Situation: Magnus wanted to deliver a beautifully designed tablet assistant sales app used in stores to communicate stock inventory across the Benelux region in real time. The sales assistant is also used to place orders along with support for a variety of payment options.

Task: As a software developer for the tablet app, with a task of creating a white labelled app for various retail brands to implement their custom looks in. The tablet app is also supposed to communicate with the backend to keep the most up-to-date stock inventory data at all retail stores.

Activities:
• Worked with the design team to create beautiful white-labeled designs for retail customers.
• Implemented the user flow of product browsing to order completion in the app.
• Integrated various payment options in the app.
• Implemented search functionality in the app to browse through product categories, store
locations, and previous orders.

Results: Delivered one of the most beautifully designed apps I have worked on to various retail customers.

Technologies: Xamarin iOS, Xamarin Android, iOS, Android, C#, SOAP, Visual Studio, JIRA, Git, Sourcetree.
profile_positions.title: Mobile Application Developer

profile_positions.description:
Situation: CED is a coordinator between repairers and customers who have experienced damage in their property. CED would like its repairers to report details on damages and estimate costs via its new app and software platform developed by Magnus.

Task: As a software developer for the mobile team, responsible for delivering the app to the entire network of repairers and service people in the NL-BE region.

Activities:
• Worked closely with the design and backend team to deliver the complete platform to CED.
• Agile method, with strong focus on using best practices of working in the software industry.
• Used test, acceptance and production environments to develop a well-tested product.
• The app used camera, biometric, and other native capabilities to provide a secure and easy way
for repairers to estimate damages.
• Worked with the clients to understand and implement their changing requirements in the repair
and insurance business.

Results: CED reported a significant increase in the efficiency and overview in its business, with more accurate estimation and tracking of costs of performing repairs in property in the Netherlands and Belgium. The app quickly became the most used software in CED.

Technologies: Xamarin iOS, Xamarin Android, iOS, Android, C#, SOAP, Visual Studio, JIRA, Git, Sourcetree.
profile_positions.title: Mobile Application Developer

profile_positions.description:
Situation: JDE Professional wanted to have a new app for its event so that attendees find it easy to navigate and network at the event.

Task: Develop an app for iOS and Android, that attendees can safely log into, and then check out talks, and other professionals attending the event.

Activities:
• Developed and designed the product for the event.
• Worked in an agile way to deliver the final product in 2 weeks.
• App to be delivered to attendees in their emails with secure and easy login through deep linking.
• A chat function was added so that attendees could give their feedback on events and rate the
talks.

Results: Delivered a product that was fun to use as much as it was to create in a short span of time.

Technologies: Xamarin Forms, iOS, Android, C#, Visual Studio, JIRA, Git, Sourcetree, Deep linking, Microsoft App Center.
profile_positions.title: Development Lead

company.name: Mitsubishi Turbocharger and Engine Europe B.V.

profile_positions.description:
Situation: Mitsubishi wanted to develop an automated performance optimisation software which could be used to increase the performance of individual components in a turbocharger.

Task: As the developer of the project, implement such a program which integrates with the softwares used by Mitsubishi to calculate performance of their components. The program should be able to take in various parameters that can be changed to study performance changes.

Activities:
• Worked with Mitsubishi’s R&D team to develop methods of integrating the tool in their workflow.
• Implemented the tool in python which could connect with the softwares used at Mitsubishi.
• Validated the tool by optimising one of the key connection components of the turbocharger
manufactured by Mitsubishi.
• Wrote detailed documentation explaining the inner workings of the tool with key steps in to using
it, and improving it in the future.

Results: Delivered a software program that fit in perfectly with Mitsubishi’s workflows using industry standard optimisation techniques and validated by academics at TU Delft.

Technologies: Python, MATLAB, Abaqus, Latex.
profile_positions.title: Project Lead

profile_positions.description:
Application of topology optimisation to the turbocharger V-clamp connection using MATLAB.

1. The concepts of topology optimisation are applied using MATLAB to obtain a sturdier and more robust V-clamp connection between the turbine housing (T/H) and the bearing housing (B/H).

2. The work involved accurate modelling (in MATLAB) of the geometry and the thermo-mechanical loading that the connection goes through in its lifecycle.

3. Different techniques and optimisation algorithms were programmed in MATLAB to test their accuracy and efficiency.

4. The optimised topology of the connection was further refined to obtain a solution geometry that could be easily implemented into the existing manufacturing process.
profile_positions.title: Intern at the Turbocharger R&D Department of MTEE

profile_positions.description:
•	Hold sole responsibility for geometrical modeling, analysis and design of all solar tracking structures of the office
•	Designed an innovative use of the slider-crank mechanism to enable azimuth tracking at less than half the normal costs
•	Conducted detailed finite element (FE) analysis of aerodynamic loading of structures in ANSYS
•	Redesigned existing structural components with truss systems to create light-weight yet much robust structures
•	Made significant contributions in all projects by carrying out the following tasks – design of shallow foundations for structures, connection verifications, buckling analysis and stability checks on members, structural detailing
profile_positions.title: Lead Structural Engineer

volunteer_experiences.description:
